definition[0]: to promise to pay someone if something they own is damaged or lost
definition[1]: to pay someone money because of loss, injury, or damage that they have suffered
definition[2]: to promise to pay for a financial loss that a person or organization may have
example[0]: You can be indemnified against claims for professional negligence, ruined holidays and so on.
example[1]: In accordance with the new policy, the company has agreed to indemnify the directors for any previous losses.
